CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper December 27, 1958, pg. 2, reads: "Sub-standard Properties - In a preliminary hearing Tuesday afternoon, before First Ward Alderman Leonard A. Civill, I. B. Lando, who has downtown offices in the Berger Building, admitted that his properties at 311 - 327 Greenfield Ave., lack modern conveniences. Lando has been ordered to reappear before Alderman Civill on Dec. 29. He asked for, and was given, the postponement in order to organize a time table for making repairs to the buildings. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Two-story brick row houses along hill at 311 - 327 Greenfield Avenue, Greenfield
